column4: Evenin' all. Having issues with Flash player on Lucid, 64 bit. Anyone know of a fix?
!flash
can you give a pastebin of: dpkg -l | grep flash; dpkg -l | grep gnash; dpkg -l | grep swf
once you get use the output we can help
Sorry, I was following the instructions on the link from ubottu.
sudo apt-get install pastebinit; dpkg -l | grep flash > ~/flash; dpkg -l | grep gnash >>~/flash; dpkg -l | grep swf >> ~/flash; pastebinit ~/flash; rm ~/flash
Only one package installed: flashplugin64-installer
ok then what's the problem? I use flashplugin64-installer :)
Well, before I started tonight, video would play really fast and no sound. Now, flash doesn't work at all.
In either Firefox or Chromium.
i'd remove it, then reinstall it
Been there, done that, 3 times.
make sure you remove the config (or use --purge) to completely remove it
Even used purge.
ok when you go to use flash, do you get ANYTHING (even a white / black box)?
In FF, I get nothing, In Chromium, I get a little black box with a sickly computer icon in it and a message which reads that the plugin crashed.
hmm, have you tried removing the package and manually copying the .so file to /usr/lib/chromium-browser/plugins
If I remove the package, how would I copy the so file?!?
you head to the adobe site and grab the 64bit tar.gz
OK, got the plugin showing up again, but it is back to playing at 4x speed and no sound.
hmmm - http://labs.adobe.com/downloads/flashplayer10_64bit.html
That's not helpful at all.... :P
looks like you'll need to use the PPA version or use flashplugin-installer whic will use nspluginwrapper
